author: alexandair
body:
I have a Nano Server container with PowerShell 7 Preview 3. When I try to connect to it from a PowerShell 7 Preview 3 session on my client, a connection fails.

```powershell
PS C:\> docker container ls --no-trunc
CONTAINER ID                                                       IMAGE                                                  COMMAND             CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
63667b4327b487452cab1e488b15b25820dbaf6c2c898294057cc4c92269fb81   mcr.microsoft.com/powershell:preview-nanoserver-1903…   "pwsh.exe"          22 seconds ago      Up 20 seconds                           quirky_diffie

PS C:\> Enter-PSSession -ContainerId 63667b4327b487452cab1e488b15b25820dbaf6c2c898294057cc4c92269fb81
Enter-PSSession : Failed to launch PowerShell process (powershell.exe) inside container with id 63667b4327b487452cab1e488b15b25820dbaf6c2c898294057cc4c92269fb81 with error: 2147942402.
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Can you connect from Windows PowerShell session to the container?

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body:
No. 

```
Enter-PSSession : Failed to launch PowerShell process inside container with id...
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: If the scenario does not work for Windows PowerShell it is not exclusively PowerShell Core issue.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body:
@iSazonov 
I don't follow you. If I try to connect from PowerShell 7 client session to a container running PowerShell 7, it sure is PowerShell Core issue.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Aye. Windows PowerShell is not, as far as I'm aware, at all capable of remoting _to_ a PowerShell Core installation under any circumstance I'm aware of, unless I'm missing something?

title: [PowerShell 7 Preview 3] Cannot connect with PowerShell Direct to Nano Server container
